title: High Female Participation in Business Ownership
description: In 2017, 70.4% of firms in Ecuador had female participation in ownership, showcasing a strong presence of women in the business sector.

title: Extensive Formal Training in Firms
description: As of 2017, 73.7% of firms in Ecuador offered formal training, indicating a commitment to employee development and skill enhancement.

title: Limited Unemployment Benefits for the Poorest
description: In 2022, only 0.0046% of Ecuador's poorest quintile received unemployment benefits, highlighting a significant gap in social safety nets.

title: Low Child Employment Rates Among Females
description: In 2015, only 0.14% of female children aged 7-14 were self-employed in Ecuador, reflecting effective child labor regulations for girls.

title: Moderate Child Employment Rates Among Males
description: In 2015, 0.31% of male children aged 7-14 were self-employed, indicating room for improvement in reducing child labor among boys.

title: Overall Low Child Employment Rates
description: In 2015, 0.24% of children aged 7-14 were self-employed in Ecuador, suggesting effective measures against child labor.
